Articles.Content:
[http://www.esa.int/spaceinimages/Images/2015/06/Hypervelocity_impact_test_damage](http://www.esa.int/spaceinimages/Images/2015/06/Hypervelocity_impact_test_damage)

This is what happen when you fire a fleck of aluminum oxide **the size of a grain of sand** at hypervelocity:

![Hypervelocity_impact_test_damage_node_full_image_2.jpg](http://www.esa.int/var/esa/storage/images/esa_multimedia/images/2015/06/hypervelocity_impact_test_damage/15436934-1-eng-GB/Hypervelocity_impact_test_damage_node_full_image_2.jpg)

The target was a 15x15cm aluminum plate 1.2mm thick. The hole in the image is 28x12 mm.

It seems like the most powerful weapon the universe has is speed. Throw something fast enough and it will obliterate anything.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-16T07:25:28Z" title="07/16/2015 07:25  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 16, 2015</time> by RainDreamer**

***P = M \* V***

That's a large hole...

EDIT:

This is incredibly relevant. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Cool.

Speed, time, and compound interest... always wear your safety goggles when dealing with any of them.

speed is definitely the most powerful factor. Ã‚Â½mvÃ‚Â². Note the vÃ‚Â².

assuming "medium" sand, from the third [reference](http://hypertextbook.com/facts/2003/MarinaTheodoris.shtml), assuming spherical at 0.25mm radius, it has a volume of 6.54498E-05cmÃ‚Â³, aluminum oxide has a density of 3.95g/cmÃ‚Â³, so the fleck is around 2.585E-04 grams.

at the lower 10km/sec they mention, and assuming their spec masses about the same as a grain of sand..., 

[2.585E-06kg * 0.5 * 1E5Ã‚Â²m/s = 12925 joules](http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=2.585E-06kg+*+0.5+*+1E5%C2%B2m%2Fs)

By comparison, that is 3.7 times the punch of a single round from one of [these](http://www.navweaps.com/Weapons/WNUS_30-cal_GAU17.htm)

> It seems like the most powerful weapon the universe have is speed. Throw something fast enough and it will obliterate anything.
